content.description: Climb through the introductory band of slabby stone and move left into the right-facing corner. Move on through to the grey/blue headwall. Pull the bulge on edges to clip a fixed draw. Mantle to glory.
content.location: Leftmost route in the Chick Magnet Sector. Look for the right facing corner.

content.description: Moderate through 3 bolts then gets quite techy before a 3 bolt boulder section. Rock gets quite sharp at the top and holds get better.
content.location: Furthest right on wall. Next to Boy Toy

content.description:
Nice route featuring some big moves between good pockets.  

  Starts on a vertical face and leads into some fun climbing on edges and pockets. Power into an undercling and clip the fixed draw. Sort out the crux and enjoy sharp blue stone to the top.
content.location: Just right of the big notched roof on the Chick Magnet Wall. Can't miss the white fixed chain draw.

content.description: Good route that starts on some junky slab, pulls a mini-roof, and features some quality climbing through a bulge on black and orange rock. Higher quality than the surrounding routes. Fun movement through the bulge.
content.location: Just left of Chick Magnet. Pulls the same mini-roof. Look for black and orange rock through a bulge.

climbs.name: The Ghost of Butt Hut Past

content.description: Climb through some low-angle rock to a vertical face. Bust out a steep boulder problem crux through black rock. Pull onto grey stone and romp to the chains.
content.location: Immediately left of the large notched roof. Higher first bolt than most of the surrounding routes.

content.description: Easier slab working up to a very small roof. Pull over and work your way further up on crimps.

climbs.name: Boy Toy
climbs.fa: bolted: Bill Ohran / FA: Misty Murphy

content.description: Mostly technical pockets and crimps working your way up to a slight over hang. Gets more difficult the further you move up.
This area host a about 8 differnt routes that range from 10a to 12a.
